info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 25 at 2:57PM CDT until October 25 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, San Saba.
* WHEN...Until 600 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Overflowing poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 257 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Saba, Richland Springs, Algerita, Sloan, Skeeterville, Hall, Spring Creek, Harkeyville and Locker. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... FM 1030 crossing Wallace Creek, CR 340 crossing San Saba River, CR 340 crossing Dry Creek, CR 208 crossing San Saba River, crossings along County Road 246 and crossings along County Road 244. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING
